thread.title: Arizona Republic 100: State's largest employers in 2016
thread.title_full: Arizona Republic 100: State's largest employers in 2016

author: Russ Wiles , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: Arizona Republic 100: State's largest employers in 2016
text:
June White joined GoDaddy's global tax and compliance department in October and says she's happy with her new employer, calling it a place with a good work/life balance. "The culture fits my personality," said White, a 28-year-old Phoenix resident. "I feel like I'm home." (Photo: Nick Oza/The Republic) 
189 CONNECT TWEET 18 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE With little fanfare, Arizona in recent months finally closed the books on the recession, with statewide employment now higher than it was prior to the downturn.
Arizona’s largest non-government employers are doing their part, gradually boosting their job totals. These diverse corporations and non-profits – retailers, resorts, semiconductor manufacturers, hospitals, restaurant chains, power utilities and others – cumulatively account for nearly 520,000 jobs, or nearly one in four private-sector positions.
But as the nation and state move closer to full employment, more big enterprises are having trouble filling positions. Meanwhile, the recent push for minimum wages of $15 an hour could pressure the finances of these enterprises, and the demands of Millennials for flexibility and greater work/life balance portend fundamental changes in the employment environment.
Our annual Republic 100 report on the state’s largest non-government employers assesses these and other trends, such as the emergence of casinos and the muscle exerted by nonprofits in health care, while highlighting the key entities on which so many Arizonans depend for a living.
